member.name: T:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger
member.summary: Represents a MSBuild file logger.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger.Path
member.summary: The path to the resulting log file.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger.Verbosity
member.summary: The logging verbosity.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger.ShowSummary
member.summary: True to show the error and warning summary at the end. Defaults to .

member.name: P:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger.ShowPerformanceSummary
member.summary: True to show the time thatâ€™s spent in tasks, targets, and projects. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger.MessageFilter
member.summary: Control which messages are shown. Defaults to .

member.name: P:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger.NoItemAndPropertyList
member.summary: True to suppress the list of items and properties that would appear at the start of each project build if the verbosity level is set to . Defaults to false.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger.ShowTimestamp
member.summary: True to show the timestamp as a prefix to any message. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger.ShowCommandLine
member.summary: True to show TaskCommandLineEvent messages. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger.ShowEventId
member.summary: True to show the event ID for each started event, finished event, and message. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger.ForceNoAlign
member.summary: True to don't align the text to the size of the console buffer. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger.DisableConsoleColor
member.summary: True to disable console colors. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger.EnableMultiprocessorLogging
member.summary: True to enable the multiprocessor logging style even when running in non-multiprocessor mode. Defaults to .

member.name: P:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger.AdditionalFlags
member.summary: Provides a way to provide additional flags that are not covered by the other options.

member.name: M:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLogger.#ctor(System.String,DryRunner.Util.MsBuildVerbosity)
member.summary: Creates a with the given and .

member.name: T:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLoggerMessageFilter
member.summary: Allows filtering the messages shown by a .

member.name: F:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLoggerMessageFilter.Everything
member.summary: Show all messages.

member.name: F:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLoggerMessageFilter.ErrorsOnly
member.summary: Show only error messages.

member.name: F:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildFileLoggerMessageFilter.WarningsOnly
member.summary: Show only warning messages.

member.name: T:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildVerbosity
member.summary: Verbosity used for MSBuild output.

member.name: F:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildVerbosity.Normal
member.summary: Normal verbosity, which displays errors, warnings, messages with high importance, some status events, and a build summary.

member.name: F:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildVerbosity.Detailed
member.summary: Detailed verbosity, which displays errors, warnings, messages with normal or high importance, all status events, and a build summary.

member.name: F:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildVerbosity.Diagnostic
member.summary: Diagnostic verbosity, which displays all errors, warnings, messages, status events, and a build summary.

member.name: F:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildVerbosity.Minimal
member.summary: Minimal verbosity, which displays errors, warnings, messages with high importance, and a build summary.

member.name: F:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildVerbosity.Quiet
member.summary: Quiet verbosity, which displays a build summary.

member.name: T:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildToolsVersion
member.summary: Represents a MSBuild tools version.

member.summary: MSBuild version included in .NET Framework 2.0

member.name: F:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildToolsVersion.v3_5
member.summary: MSBuild version included in .NET Framework 3.5

member.name: F:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildToolsVersion.v4_0
member.summary: MSBuild version included in .NET Framework 4.0

member.name: F:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildToolsVersion.v12_0
member.summary: MSBuild version included with Visual Studio 2013

member.name: F:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildToolsVersion.v14_0
member.summary: MSBuild version included with Visual Studio 2015

member.name: F:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildToolsVersion.v15_0
member.summary: MSBuild version included with Visual Studio 2017

member.name: M:DryRunner.Util.MsBuildToolsVersion.Custom(System.String)
member.summary: Enables creation of a that is covered in the default cases.

member.name: T:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteServerOptions
member.summary: Options for customizing the way a test site is hosted (inside IISExpress)

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteServerOptions.Port
member.summary: Port to use for the IIS Express instance. Defaults to 8888 for HTTP and 4433 for HTTPS.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteServerOptions.ApplicationPath
member.summary: Website application path. Defaults to the server root "/".

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteServerOptions.ShowIisExpressWindow
member.summary: True to make the IIS Express command-line window visible, otherwise false. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteServerOptions.EnableWindowsAuthentication
member.summary: Enables Windows Authentication for IIS Express.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteServerOptions.UseHttps
member.summary: Use HTTPS for hosting, default is .

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteServerOptions.Use64BitIisExpress
member.summary: Use a 64-bit IIS Express, default is .

member.name: M:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteServerOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

member.name: T:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions
member.summary: Options for customizing the way a test site is deployed (=built and packaged with MSBuild)

member.name: T:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.ResolveMsBuildExePath
member.summary: Returns a path to an MSBuild executable dependent on the and the flag.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.ProjectFolderName
member.summary: Name of the directory containing the project file. With a full project file path of 'C:\Solution\Project\ProjectFile.csproj' the ProjectFolderName would be 'Project'.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.ProjectFileName
member.summary: File name of the website project you want to test, including the extension (e.g. .csproj, .vbproj).

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.SolutionDir
member.summary: The path to the solution file. This is used to set the SolutionDir property so that it can be used in MSBuild macros.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.DeployDirectory
member.summary: The directory the web application is deployed to (defaults to "{ProjectDir}\obj\{BuildConfiguration}\Package\PackageTmp"). Note that, the deploy directory is not automatically cleaned up, this has to be done outside of DryRunner.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.BuildTargets
member.summary: The build targets that are invoked in MSBuild. Defaults to 'Clean' and 'Package'.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.BuildConfiguration
member.summary: Build configuration to use. Defaults to 'Test'.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.TransformationConfiguration
member.summary: Configuration to use for the configuration file transformation (e.g. Test means that Web.Test.config is used). Defaults to .

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.AdditionalBuildProperties
member.summary: Can be used to specify additional build properties that are passed to MSBuild.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.MsBuildToolsVersion
member.summary: The MSBuild tools version that is used to build. Defaults to '4.0'.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.MsBuildVerbosity
member.summary: The verbosity used for MSBuild log output. Defaults to .

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.AdditionalMsBuildFileLoggers
member.summary: Allows specifying additional s to be used. Only allows up to 7 additional s (since MSBuild only supports 9 and 2 are already used internally)!

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.Use64BitMsBuild
member.summary: True to use a 64-bit version of MSBuild. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.MsBuildExePathResolver
member.summary: Function that resolves the MSBuild exe path dependent on the and . Can be overwritten to use a non-default MSBuild exe path.

member.name: P:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.ShowMsBuildWindow
member.summary: True to make the IIS Express command-line window visible, otherwise false. Defaults to false.

member.name: M:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates new . Use this constructor when the project folder and file name are equal (e.g. 'C:\Solution\Project\Project.csproj').

member.name: M:DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates new . Use this constructor when the project folder and file name are not equal (e.g. 'C:\Solution\ProjectFolder\ProjectFile.csproj').

member.name: T:DryRunner.TestSiteDeployer
member.summary: Builds and packages the test site using MSBuild.

member.name: P:DryRunner.TestSiteDeployer.TestSitePath
member.summary: The path at which the built and packaged test site lies.

member.name: M:DryRunner.TestSiteDeployer.#ctor(DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions)
member.summary: Creates a new test site deployed using options defined in .

member.name: M:DryRunner.TestSiteDeployer.Deploy
member.summary: Deploys (builds and packages) the test site.

member.name: T:DryRunner.TestSiteManager
member.summary: Deploys and hosts a test site (by using and .

member.name: M:DryRunner.TestSiteManager.#ctor(DryRunner.Options.TestSiteDeployerOptions,DryRunner.Options.TestSiteServerOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:DryRunner.TestSiteManager.#ctor(System.String,DryRunner.Options.TestSiteServerOptions)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Name of the web project. This is assumed to be both the project folder name, and also the .csproj name (without the .csproj extension). If the project folder name and .csproj name are different, use the constructor.

member.name: M:DryRunner.TestSiteManager.Start
member.summary: Deploys and starts the configured test site.

member.name: M:DryRunner.TestSiteManager.Stop
member.summary: Stops the configured test site.

member.name: T:DryRunner.TestSiteServer
member.summary: Hosts the test site in IISExpress.

member.name: M:DryRunner.TestSiteServer.#ctor(System.String,DryRunner.Options.TestSiteServerOptions)
member.summary: Creates a new test site server that hosts the application located on the given using options defined in .

member.name: M:DryRunner.TestSiteServer.#ctor(DryRunner.TestSiteDeployer,DryRunner.Options.TestSiteServerOptions)
member.summary: Creates a new test site server that hosts the application deployed by the given using options defined in .

member.name: M:DryRunner.TestSiteServer.Start
member.summary: Starts the IISExpress process that hosts the test site.

member.name: M:DryRunner.TestSiteServer.Stop
member.summary: Stops the IISExpress process that hosts the test site.
